dialogue.String: 1�I've been waiting for you. I heard from one of my sources that you were going to be on that boat from Mhaura.
1�Now, what did you find? You saw an evil spirit, didn't you?Hmm? There was no treasure? But that can't be...
1�But there was. Look at this.
1�You... You're the guy who told me to wait here...
1�Our adventurer here may not have realized it, but there was a piece of paper in the torn rags of the spirit �[he/she] defeated. The men on our boat found that memo.
1�However, as death approaches me, I have come to realize that maybe it is not my knowledge that is important, but my memories.
1�Wait. This is it? What is he trying to say?
1�I know.To pass on their memories...that is what drives a parent.
1�Who are you...
1�I am Yomi's husband. Many years ago, she met your grandfather here in this very town.
1�By that time she was already carrying our daughter, Ayame.
1�I am not ashamed of what I have done. I am ready to pass my memories on to someone special...our child.
1�Not the memories of the skills I have acquired, but the memories of the way of life I have lived--the way of the ninja.
1�I want those memories to live on in your heart...
1�Those who are obsessed in mastering their skills often lose sight of the reason they first began walking down that path.
1�Mitsunari wanted you to know that. That is why his spirit remained at sea.
1�Grandfather...
1�I-I apologize if...
1�Ha! When are you going to stop acting like a frightened puppy and turn into a real man?
1�Oh, and you. For your troubles, you can have Mitsunari's #����.
1�Leodarion asked me to give it to you before he left.
1�And now we're back to where we started...So long,  . I have a feeling I'll be seeing you again soon.
1�I hear about you a lot. People say you do much for Selbina.
1�I speak for the whole town when I say thank you. Thank you.
1�Thing is, the turtlebacks are on the move. Word is they're up to no good.
1�I'm itching to go smash them, but I can't leave the town defenseless.
1�Maybe you could go instead. What do you say?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Thanks. The turtlebacks often strike merchants headed to our village. Another caravan was attacked just the other day.
1�They fled, but two of them were taken prisoner.
1�The turtlebacks prowling outside came from Beadeaux. We think the merchants are held captive there.
1�Their names are Evrard and Serafin.
1�They say that the turtlebacks keep prisoners locked up tight. Somewhere in Beadeaux there should be such a place.
1�The merchants who made it here said that they were different from other turtlebacks. I hope that helps.
1�I hate asking others to do our job, but please, rescue the two captives. Their families need them.
1�Oh? Pity... I hoped you would say yes.
1�But you did well. Thank you! This is for your service.
1�Oh, you again. Thanks for all you've done for us. We need all the help we can get.
1�No reports of trouble recently. For us, no news is good news!
1�They fled, but two of them were taken prisoner.
1�The turtlebacks prowling outside came from Beadeaux. We think the merchants are held captive there.
1�Their names are Evrard and Serafin.
1�They say that the turtlebacks keep prisoners locked up tight. Somewhere in Beadeaux there should be such a place.
1�The merchants who made it here said that they were different from other turtlebacks. I hope that helps.
1�I hate asking others to do our job, but please, rescue the two captives. Their families need them.
1�This is the mayor's mansion. Our mayor is a good man. Go inside and say hello.
1�The Valkurm Dunes is Selbina's territory, but our militia is too few to patrol it. It is sad, but you adventurers must keep the sands safe.
1�Whew, I'm so glad we're free! We owe our lives to you!
1�Ah, perfect! We just arrived as well.
1�You saved our lives, friend! Let us thank you as well. Here, take this!
1�Have you visited the mayor's office yet? That Naillina knows so much about everything!
1�I've noticed an awfully suspicious-looking fellow visit town recently. Have you seen him?
1�Isacio used to be a knight a long time ago. I wonder what brought him here...
1�Zaldon has all kinds of tales to tell. But he's so stubborn your head will ache!
1�Gabwaleid actually knows a lot about fishing. He'll teach you whatever you need to know.
1�The inn's cook, Valgeir, whips up some fantastic dishes. I wish I had enough money to try one!
1�Mayor Abelard is more like a scientist than a politician. He's into some kind of research.
1�Vuntar's an earnest worker. Come to think of it, he's been working here as long as I can remember...
1�Melyon is so proud of his sheep, isn't he? He's thought up interesting names for them.
1�Romeo is always thinking up new ways to make money. And I think he's pretty good at it, too.
1�My name's Manfried and I'm a deputy along with Flandiace. Velema's our sergeant, and the three of us serve under Thunder Hawk.
1�My name's Manfried and I'm a deputy along with Flandiace. Velema's our sergeant, and the three of us serve under Thunder Hawk.
1�Well, well. Nice to see a new face. This your first time to Selbina?
1�Well, is it?Why, yes.No, I come here all the time.
1�Oh. I think you should go see the mayor.
1�Oh. By the way, it's a good idea to show your face to our mayor if you still haven't.
1�I'm Velema. I keep watch over the docks.
1�Is there a problem? See the mayor if you have any questions.
1�Visitors often ask me how to find the mines of Palborough. What could they want from its dark and twisting tunnels?
1�Hello there. Is this your first visit to our fine town?
1�Well, is it?Why, yes.No, I come here all the time.
1�Yes, I thought as much. You'd best head to the mayor's office.
1�Our village may be small, but so many stop here to rest on the road between Bastok and San d'Oria.
1�Sorry, the station is for militia personnel only.
1�If you're heading outside, remember that there's safety in numbers. Gather people of different talents to cover any weaknesses.
1�If you're here for the ship, the docks are straight down the stairs from here.
1�Welcome to the Shepherd's Muster.
1�Herminia carries a wide selection of goods, and Torapiont is always available for your weaponry needs.

1�Well, if that's the case, he's standing right behind you.

1�Fine, then! I'll prepare your little dish, but first you must bring me the ingredients I require.
1�I'll need  $���� and  $����. Now, make haste!
1�Hmph. So you found them, did you? Fine! Come see me tomorrow. It should be ready by then.

1�Done! Now, take it and get out of here!
1�What, you again? Well, I'm not about to chastise you. Very well, I'll have a look. Give me a moment.
1�It's true he has improved. But still he fails to grasp the basics of cooking. There's more to it than haggling over ingredients!
1�Everything has a foundation, not just cooking. Making things good on the outside is easy; it is what's inside that counts.
1�Only when one has understood the basics can they make the inside good. Amateurs hurry the most; too often they focus on appearance.
1�Rycharde is the perfect example. He simply isn't the prodigy I hoped for.
1�He may be my son, but he'll never be a chef in my eyes. Well, that's a lecture not meant for you.
1�Are you heading back now? Please, give this to him. Tell him it's my reply. If he doesn't understand what it means, then that will be it.
1�You gave it to him, did you not? Back when I started teaching him how to cook, I often had him use %���� in his dishes.
1��%���� come cheaply of late. But that doesn't rule them out as ingredients.
1�You could also use pricey ingredients, and even though your utensils might be mediocre, your food will still come out tasting fine.
1�Delicious food is not made from fancy spices or cutlery. Nor does it come from any methodical analysis.
1�Indeed, nothing is more crucial than the desire to satisfy others with good food, and thinking up ways to do it.
1�If my son could only realize that, there may still be some hope for him.
1�What? I'm busy. Can't this wait till later?
1�What now? It's not done yet! Don't worry, my dishes are always ready on time.
1�What now? It's done, so leave me in peace!
1�Oh, you again. I hope you liked the dish.
1�You gave it to him, did you not? I do hope he understood.
1�Cooking is a complex art, but the basics are as clear as day. I suppose that goes for just about anything.
1�Never forget to give thanks at each meal. The hands of many work hard to bring us sustenance.
1�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village. It's so tiny, you see, that all I do is mediate when there are disagreements.
1�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village. It's so tiny, you see, that all I do is mediate when there are disagreements.
1�In my spare time I research the life of Gwynham, the man who charted the maps we all carry today.
1�He was an adventurer, like you. His travels took him far and wide, and slowly he fleshed out his maps.
1�One day I discovered that stone monuments bearing his words lie in various places all over the world.
1�It seems each monument carries a different quote. I'd love to rush out there and see them all, but it's tough at my age.
1�Say, maybe you could help me gather his words! Well, what do you say?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�What a relief! Well, there's no time to lose! Let's get you started on one close by.
1�Take this clay to the monument in West Ronfaure, and press it firmly upon the inscription. Then, bring it back so I can print a copy for my collection.
1�Nobody seems to know exactly where to find the monument, so I suppose it might be difficult to find. Take care!
1�Is that right? Well, that's too bad. Come back if you ever have a change of heart.
1�At last! You've done it! You have my warmest thanks. Here, this is a reward for your effort. Don't expect too much from this old man, though, hehe.
1�Well? Do you want to bring back another one for me?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Actually, I don't know where the others are. You'll have to find them and make the impressions yourself. Good luck, and take care!

1�Welcome to the mayor's residence. How can I help you?

1�I can tell you much about Selbina.

1�Very well. Selbina was established by Bastok as a haven for ships bearing Gustaberg ore. She soon grew into a thriving port town.
1�Selbina declared neutrality at the outbreak of the Great War and maintains her independence to this day.
1�Very well. Our fair town lies in the middle of Valkurm Dunes, here in central Quon.
1�Most of the coastline consists of dunes and shallows. Selbina stands atop the only suitable harbor.
1�Very well. Thanks to the harbor, industry in Selbina has prospered throughout the ages.
1�But airships are the wave of the future, so we are trying to develop local industries such as fishing and agriculture.
1�Please come back if you have any questions. Good day.
1�Very well. Here we have regional salesrooms of the Fishermen's and Weavers' Guilds, as well as an inn and the sea travel agency.
1�You can purchase weapons from Torapiont inside the inn, and local items from Dohdjuma in front of the warehouse.
1�Please come back if you have any questions. Good day.
1�Another adventurer in Selbina? I don't know where you come from, but you must be quite resourceful to make it this far out.
1�These days, folks like you spend every hard-earned gil on shiny new weapons and armor.
1�And then they just toss out their old onion-gear as if it were rubbish!
1�Why, my father always scolded me whenever I left trash about! Indeed, a true adventurer would not litter, and neither should you!
1�That's why I thought of a plan: I'd gather old, worn-out onion equipment and recycle them.
1�That's where you come in! Bring me five pieces of onion equipment, and I'll reward you for your efforts.
1�That's where you come in! Bring me five pieces of onion equipment, and I'll reward you for your efforts.
1�Yes, these will do nicely! Take this as a token of my thanks.
1�Remember, never just throw anything away. There is always a use for things!
1�Now, once I get these little onions mended and polished, I'll send them off for sale abroad. I'm sure new recruits will find them useful.

1�How could I forget my promise? This is but a mere token of my thanks, but take it; you've more than earned it!
1�I've been all over Vana'diel, but the inn here is my favorite. It's not the most luxurious place in the world, but I love the relaxed atmosphere.

1�Say, have you heard? Pirates roam the seas between Selbina and Mhaura. You watch out. One never knows when they'll strike next!
1�Orcs to the north, turtlebacks to the south... With the ocean now swarming with corsairs, our village is the only haven!

1�We work the docks. Trade ships couldn't sail without us, but I guess we'd starve without them, too.

1�Fish Ranking is a contest held periodically by the Fishermen's Guild. Participants compete based on a set of defined rules regarding the size and weight of a certain big fish.

1�To participate, you must acquire the fish we specified for the contest and bring it here. We won't look over your shoulder to see if you're catching your fish or buying them. That's your personal decision.
1�You can only have one fish entered for Fish Ranking at once. You can choose to overwrite your current entry with a new catch, but you won't be able to re-register your previous submission.
1�We will announce the results after the submission period ends. The top ten entries will receive a modest award and prize money, as well as a new title.
1�Fish are judged based on a set of predetermined rules.
1�The rules are simple. All fish are inscribed with their size (Im) and weight (Pz). The contest may be judged based on either number, or even both values added together.
1�Depending on the rules, the person who caught the fish with the lowest or the greatest value wins!

1�Value is determined by the calculation of ��points�� and evaluated based on the contest rules. For example, when the rules designate the ��smallest fish,�� the person with the fewest points will win.
1�During the submission period, I will inform everyone what criterion we are judging by, so just ask if you're curious!
1�If you would like to submit an entry, please trade the fish specified for the contest to me, and I will give it a rough inspection.

1�The fish will be registered if I deem it is suitable for the contest.You may only have one fish registered at a time. Registering a second specimen will remove your previous submission from the entry database.
1�After you pay the registration fee, I will return your fish to you. All that's left afterwards is to wait for the results.
1�To ensure a fair contest, we will label your fish before returning it.
1�This will not affect the fish other than disqualifying it from reentry in Fish Ranking. You can still cook the fish, sell it at auction, or use it for quests.
1�After the submission period ends, the results will be announced. To view the ranking board, just speak to me.
1�Anybody may view the ranking board. You'll especially want to check if you or a friend participated in the last contest. Perhaps one of you will be listed on the board, too!
1�The top ten contestants will receive a modest award consisting of prize money from the Fishermen's Guild and a new title.
1�In addition, participants in the top twenty will receive  $���� as a souvenir.
1�You may only receive your award while the results are being announced, so be sure that you are here on time!
